supportPages.title: 1. Open WatchTo5K on your Apple Watch
supportPages.subtitle:
WatchTo5K should have automatically installed on your watch. Open it from the Watch App Launcher.

If the app has not automatically installed on your watch. Open the `Watch` App on your Phone, scroll down to WatchTo5K and tap install.

supportPages.title: 2. Select a Run
supportPages.subtitle: Select Week 1 Run 1 from the list (if you wish to start from a later point in the plan scroll down and select a different run).

supportPages.title: 3. Hit Start and Accept the Health Permissions
supportPages.subtitle: The first time you start a run you will be asked to grant Health Data Read/Write access and Location permissions. These are required to read health data from your watch during your workout and store your finished run. Granting location permissions allows the app to associate a route with your run so you can see it on a map in the WatchTo5K app.

supportPages.title: Don't run too fast
supportPages.subtitle: Your body has to get used to the new stresses and strains of running. Many beginner runners start out jogging too fast and pay the price for this mistake within just a few minutes. Frustration, overexertion, pain or even injuries are just some of the consequences. Therefore, start running at a moderate pace (i.e. where you can hold a conversation).

supportPages.title: Take a rest day between each run
supportPages.subtitle: You should wait a day before attempting the next workout to allow your body needs to rest so it can recover. Aim to do 3 runs per week and have 4 rest days. This extra rest day can give you greater flexibility of when to run.

supportPages.title: Don’t focus on your pace as a new runner
supportPages.subtitle: Focus on just showing up consistently for the runs and stick to the program. We all start at different places, so don't compare your start to someone else's chapter six. Your pace will improve as you progress through the plan as will your distance.

supportPages.title: Celebrate your achievements
supportPages.subtitle:
Remember to celebrate your achievements throughout the program. Getting started is often the hardest part and you have already done that!

Share you achievements with your friends and family.
Buy yourself a new piece of running clothing, go for brunch, get a massage or sign up for a race!

supportPages.title: Make running social
supportPages.subtitle: Running with a friend can make a slog seem like a jaunt, even if you save all the actual chatting for afterwards.

items.title: Opening WatchTo5K on your Apple Watch.

supportPages.title: Opening the App
supportPages.subtitle:
The WatchTo5K app should have automatically installed on your watch and should be visible in your app list when you press the digital crown.

If you can not see it on your Watches then you can manually start the installation from your phone (outlined on the next page).

supportPages.title: Manually installing the Watch App
supportPages.subtitle: Open the "Watch" App on your phone, scroll down to Uninstalled Apps and tap install next to WatchTo5K. This will trigger the installation providing your watch is nearby, has a connection to your phone (via Bluetooth or Wi-Fi) and is powered on with over 50% battery remaining. Once completed WatchTo5K will move to the "Installed on Apple Watch" list. It will now appear on your Watches App Home screen as shown on the previous page.

items.title: Enable the Virtual Coach when using headphones

supportPages.title: 1. Connect your headphones to your Watch
supportPages.subtitle:
Connect your Bluetooth headphones (such as AirPods) to your watch (rather than your iPhone). On your watch go to Settings → Bluetooth and select your Bluetooth headphones from the list so they show as connected.

Additional details on how to connect your headphones to your watch can be found at https://support.apple.com/en-gb/HT204218.

supportPages.title: 2. Launch the WatchTo5K app on the watch
supportPages.subtitle: After you have connected your headphones launch the WatchTo5k app again and you should hear audio prompts during your workout.

supportPages.title: No Audio over AirPods?
supportPages.subtitle: If you are still not hearing prompts during the workout over your AirPods then enable "Speak over watch speaker" in the Run Settings on the WatchTo5K watch app. This will force the app to play the audio prompts and cause AirPods to become active if they are connected.

items.title: Enable the Virtual Coach over the Watches built in speaker

supportPages.title: Go to Run Settings on your watch
supportPages.subtitle:
Select a run then scroll to the bottom of the run overview screen and locate the `Run Settings` button. Tap the Run Settings button and enable 'Speak over watch speaker'.

All future runs will now use the speaker for prompts.

supportPages.title: Run with music/podcasts
supportPages.subtitle:
Watch to 5K can work alongside other music/audio apps installed on your Apple Watch.

These apps need to be playing audio directly from your watch (rather than acting as a control for an iPhone app).

supportPages.title: 1. Connect your headphones to your watch
supportPages.subtitle: Go to settings > Bluetooth (on watch) and ensure headphones are connected.

supportPages.title: 2. Open music/podcast app
supportPages.subtitle:
Open an audio app (e.g Spotify) and ensure playback is from the watch.

In Spotify do this by tapping the icon on the bottom right (will probably look like a phone) and when pressed pick Apple Watch as the source.

supportPages.title: 3. Open Watch to 5K
supportPages.subtitle:
Start a run and your music will now mute when the coach instructions play.

You can swipe to the left to access the now playing controls.

items.title: Using the app Indoors on a treadmill

supportPages.title: Go to Run Settings on your watch
supportPages.subtitle:
Select a run then scroll to the bottom of the run overview screen and locate the `Run Settings` button. Tap the Run Settings button and turn off 'Outdoor run'.

All future runs will now be treated as indoor runs.

items.title: Viewing completed runs in miles or kilometers

supportPages.title: Go to a completed run
supportPages.subtitle:
Open the My Runs tab and select one of your completed runs.

Select the ellipsis menu icon in the top right and tap Switch to miles/kilometers.
This will change the metric used for distance and pace for the selected run.

Tip: You can also quickly toggle the metrics by tapping the distance or pace tile.

supportPages.title: The watch app will always stay in kilometers
supportPages.subtitle: The Watch to 5K plan focuses on building you up to a 5KM run, so the watch app constantly shows your workout stats in kilometers.

items.title: Do I need to carry my phone with me on my run?
items.text: No, the application will run independently on your watch without the need for your iPhone.

items.title: Do I need to record a workout using Apples Workout app when using WatchTo5K?
items.text: No. WatchTo5K will automatically record and store relevant workout activity while you run. This data will contribute to your Apple fitness rings.

items.title: Do I need to complete runs in order or can I skip some?
items.text: You can start any run at any point (simply select it on the watch). There is no need to go in order or to start from the beginning of the plan. Your overall progress in the iPhone companion app is based on the furthest run you complete in the plan (so if you complete the plan but skip a few of the earlier runs you can still reach 100% progress).

items.title: Why is some data missing from my completed runs?
items.text:
Missing data in runs (such as heart rate or distance) is usually due to missing permissions. The app needs to be able to read the data from your Apple Watch to be able to process and store it alongside runs.
Please grant all the permissions to the app. To do this go to **Settings > Health > Apps > Watch to 5K**. On this screen ensure all the toggles are enabled (showing as green).

items.title: Why can't I hear audio prompts over my bluetooth headphones?
items.text: Confirm your Bluetooth headphones (such as AirPods) are connected to your watch rather than your iPhone. For more details see **Enable the Virtual Coach when using headphones** above.

items.title: Is it possible to reset the trophies in the app?
items.text: Yes. Go to the **Progress** tab, select the more menu in the top right (button with 3 dots) and select **Restart Plan**.

items.title: Why are 3 workout activities recorded in Apple Health for a single run?
items.text:
Warmup and cooldown activities are recorded as separate entries as they are unlikely to change as your progress through the program. The actual main program is recorded as one single run workout entry which includes all the run and walk segments.

As you progress through the program you start doing more and more run segments and towards the end of the program sessions just consist of running. By keeping the warmup and cooldown separate you can easily compare your progress over time and look at your distance, average speed and heart rate (without the warmup and cooldown walks skewing the data).

items.title: Does the application require an active cellular connection?
items.text: No, the application does not require an active cellular connection and will run on Apple Watches without a cellular chip.

items.title: What versions of the Apple Watch does the app work on?
items.text: The app requires watchOS 6.0 or later. All watches from Series 2 onwards support WatchOS 6+.

items.title: Can I import my runs into Strava or other third-party apps?
items.text:
Watch to 5K stores all of its run data in Apple Health. Apple Health is a central and secure place that third-party apps can read and write to (providing you have permitted them to do so).

Any third-party app that can read Running data from Apple Health will be able to see Watch to 5K runs.

**Strava does not** allow third party workouts stored in Apple Health to sync to Strava. However, there are third-party applications (such as *[HealthFit](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/healthfit/id1202650514)*) that you can use on your phone that can read from the shared Apple Health Store and then export data to Strava.

items.title: I am not happy with the application. Is it possible to get a refund?
items.text: Sorry to hear that the app isn’t providing enough value for you! Please contact us below to see if we can help.
